clarena.cl_algorithms.fgadahat

The submodule in cl_algorithms for FG-AdaHAT algorithm.

   1r"""
   2The submodule in `cl_algorithms` for FG-AdaHAT algorithm.
   3"""
   4
   5__all__ = ["FGAdaHAT"]
   6
   7import logging
   8import math
   9from typing import Any
  10
  11import torch
  12from captum.attr import (
  13    InternalInfluence,
  14    LayerConductance,
  15    LayerDeepLift,
  16    LayerDeepLiftShap,
  17    LayerFeatureAblation,
  18    LayerGradCam,
  19    LayerGradientShap,
  20    LayerGradientXActivation,
  21    LayerIntegratedGradients,
  22    LayerLRP,
  23)
  24from torch import Tensor
  25
  26from clarena.backbones import HATMaskBackbone
  27from clarena.cl_algorithms import AdaHAT
  28from clarena.heads import HeadsTIL
  29from clarena.utils.metrics import HATNetworkCapacityMetric
  30from clarena.utils.transforms import min_max_normalize

  33pylogger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

  35
  36class FGAdaHAT(AdaHAT):
  37    r"""FG-AdaHAT (Fine-Grained Adaptive Hard Attention to the Task) algorithm.
  38
  39    An architecture-based continual learning approach that improves [AdaHAT (Adaptive Hard Attention to the Task)](https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-70352-2_9) by introducing fine-grained neuron-wise importance measures guiding the adaptive adjustment mechanism in AdaHAT.
  40
  41    We implement FG-AdaHAT as a subclass of AdaHAT, as it reuses AdaHAT's summative mask and other components.
  42    """
  43
  44    def __init__(
  45        self,
  46        backbone: HATMaskBackbone,
  47        heads: HeadsTIL,
  48        adjustment_intensity: float,
  49        importance_type: str,
  50        importance_summing_strategy: str,
  51        importance_scheduler_type: str,
  52        neuron_to_weight_importance_aggregation_mode: str,
  53        s_max: float,
  54        clamp_threshold: float,
  55        mask_sparsity_reg_factor: float,
  56        mask_sparsity_reg_mode: str = "original",
  57        base_importance: float = 0.01,
  58        base_mask_sparsity_reg: float = 0.1,
  59        base_linear: float = 10,
  60        filter_by_cumulative_mask: bool = False,
  61        filter_unmasked_importance: bool = True,
  62        step_multiply_training_mask: bool = True,
  63        task_embedding_init_mode: str = "N01",
  64        importance_summing_strategy_linear_step: float | None = None,
  65        importance_summing_strategy_exponential_rate: float | None = None,
  66        importance_summing_strategy_log_base: float | None = None,
  67    ) -> None:
  68        r"""Initialize the FG-AdaHAT algorithm with the network.
  69
  70        **Args:**
  71        - **backbone** (`HATMaskBackbone`): must be a backbone network with the HAT mask mechanism.
  72        - **heads** (`HeadsTIL`): output heads. FG-AdaHAT supports only TIL (Task-Incremental Learning).
  73        - **adjustment_intensity** (`float`): hyperparameter, controls the overall intensity of gradient adjustment (the $\alpha$ in the paper).
  74        - **importance_type** (`str`): the type of neuron-wise importance, must be one of:
  75            1. 'input_weight_abs_sum': sum of absolute input weights;
  76            2. 'output_weight_abs_sum': sum of absolute output weights;
  77            3. 'input_weight_gradient_abs_sum': sum of absolute gradients of the input weights (Input Gradients (IG) in the paper);
  78            4. 'output_weight_gradient_abs_sum': sum of absolute gradients of the output weights (Output Gradients (OG) in the paper);
  79            5. 'activation_abs': absolute activation;
  80            6. 'input_weight_abs_sum_x_activation_abs': sum of absolute input weights multiplied by absolute activation (Input Contribution Utility (ICU) in the paper);
  81            7. 'output_weight_abs_sum_x_activation_abs': sum of absolute output weights multiplied by absolute activation (Contribution Utility (CU) in the paper);
  82            8. 'gradient_x_activation_abs': absolute gradient (the saliency) multiplied by activation;
  83            9. 'input_weight_gradient_square_sum': sum of squared gradients of the input weights;
  84            10. 'output_weight_gradient_square_sum': sum of squared gradients of the output weights;
  85            11. 'input_weight_gradient_square_sum_x_activation_abs': sum of squared gradients of the input weights multiplied by absolute activation (Activation Fisher Information (AFI) in the paper);
  86            12. 'output_weight_gradient_square_sum_x_activation_abs': sum of squared gradients of the output weights multiplied by absolute activation;
  87            13. 'conductance_abs': absolute layer conductance;
  88            14. 'internal_influence_abs': absolute internal influence (Internal Influence (II) in the paper);
  89            15. 'gradcam_abs': absolute Grad-CAM;
  90            16. 'deeplift_abs': absolute DeepLIFT (DeepLIFT (DL) in the paper);
  91            17. 'deepliftshap_abs': absolute DeepLIFT-SHAP;
  92            18. 'gradientshap_abs': absolute Gradient-SHAP (Gradient SHAP (GS) in the paper);
  93            19. 'integrated_gradients_abs': absolute Integrated Gradients;
  94            20. 'feature_ablation_abs': absolute Feature Ablation (Feature Ablation (FA) in the paper);
  95            21. 'lrp_abs': absolute Layer-wise Relevance Propagation (LRP);
  96            22. 'cbp_adaptation': the adaptation function in [Continual Backpropagation (CBP)](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-024-07711-7);
  97            23. 'cbp_adaptive_contribution': the adaptive contribution function in [Continual Backpropagation (CBP)](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-024-07711-7);
  98        - **importance_summing_strategy** (`str`): the strategy to sum neuron-wise importance for previous tasks, must be one of:
  99            1. 'add_latest': add the latest neuron-wise importance to the summative importance;
 100            2. 'add_all': add all previous neuron-wise importance (including the latest) to the summative importance;
 101            3. 'add_average': add the average of all previous neuron-wise importance (including the latest) to the summative importance;
 102            4. 'linear_decrease': weigh the previous neuron-wise importance by a linear factor that decreases with the task ID;
 103            5. 'quadratic_decrease': weigh the previous neuron-wise importance that decreases quadratically with the task ID;
 104            6. 'cubic_decrease': weigh the previous neuron-wise importance that decreases cubically with the task ID;
 105            7. 'exponential_decrease': weigh the previous neuron-wise importance by an exponential factor that decreases with the task ID;
 106            8. 'log_decrease': weigh the previous neuron-wise importance by a logarithmic factor that decreases with the task ID;
 107            9. 'factorial_decrease': weigh the previous neuron-wise importance that decreases factorially with the task ID;
 108        - **importance_scheduler_type** (`str`): the scheduler for importance, i.e., the factor $c^t$ multiplied to parameter importance. Must be one of:
 109            1. 'linear_sparsity_reg': $c^t = (t+b_L) \cdot [R(M^t, M^{<t}) + b_R]$, where $R(M^t, M^{<t})$ is the mask sparsity regularization betwwen the current task and previous tasks, $b_L$ is the base linear factor (see argument `base_linear`), and $b_R$ is the base mask sparsity regularization factor (see argument `base_mask_sparsity_reg`);
 110            2. 'sparsity_reg': $c^t = [R(M^t, M^{<t}) + b_R]$;
 111            3. 'summative_mask_sparsity_reg': $c^t_{l,ij} = \left(\min \left(m^{<t, \text{sum}}_{l,i}, m^{<t, \text{sum}}_{l-1,j}\right)+b_L\right) \cdot [R(M^t, M^{<t}) + b_R]$.
 112        - **neuron_to_weight_importance_aggregation_mode** (`str`): aggregation mode from neuron-wise to weight-wise importance ($\text{Agg}(\cdot)$ in the paper), must be one of:
 113            1. 'min': take the minimum of neuron-wise importance for each weight;
 114            2. 'max': take the maximum of neuron-wise importance for each weight;
 115            3. 'mean': take the mean of neuron-wise importance for each weight.
 116        - **s_max** (`float`): hyperparameter, the maximum scaling factor in the gate function. See Sec. 2.4 "Hard Attention Training" in the [HAT paper](http://proceedings.mlr.press/v80/serra18a).
 117        - **clamp_threshold** (`float`): the threshold for task embedding gradient compensation. See Sec. 2.5 "Embedding Gradient Compensation" in the [HAT paper](http://proceedings.mlr.press/v80/serra18a).
 118        - **mask_sparsity_reg_factor** (`float`): hyperparameter, the regularization factor for mask sparsity.
 119        - **mask_sparsity_reg_mode** (`str`): the mode of mask sparsity regularization, must be one of:
 120            1. 'original' (default): the original mask sparsity regularization in the [HAT paper](http://proceedings.mlr.press/v80/serra18a).
 121            2. 'cross': the cross version of mask sparsity regularization.
 122        - **base_importance** (`float`): base value added to importance ($b_I$ in the paper). Default: 0.01.
 123        - **base_mask_sparsity_reg** (`float`): base value added to mask sparsity regularization factor in the importance scheduler ($b_R$ in the paper). Default: 0.1.
 124        - **base_linear** (`float`): base value added to the linear factor in the importance scheduler ($b_L$ in the paper). Default: 10.
 125        - **filter_by_cumulative_mask** (`bool`): whether to multiply the cumulative mask to the importance when calculating adjustment rate. Default: False.
 126        - **filter_unmasked_importance** (`bool`): whether to filter unmasked importance values (set to 0) at the end of task training. Default: False.
 127        - **step_multiply_training_mask** (`bool`): whether to multiply the training mask to the importance at each training step. Default: True.
 128        - **task_embedding_init_mode** (`str`): the initialization mode for task embeddings, must be one of:
 129            1. 'N01' (default): standard normal distribution $N(0, 1)$.
 130            2. 'U-11': uniform distribution $U(-1, 1)$.
 131            3. 'U01': uniform distribution $U(0, 1)$.
 132            4. 'U-10': uniform distribution $U(-1, 0)$.
 133            5. 'last': inherit the task embedding from the last task.
 134        - **importance_summing_strategy_linear_step** (`float` | `None`): linear step for the importance summing strategy (used when `importance_summing_strategy` is 'linear_decrease'). Must be > 0.
 135        - **importance_summing_strategy_exponential_rate** (`float` | `None`): exponential rate for the importance summing strategy (used when `importance_summing_strategy` is 'exponential_decrease'). Must be > 1.
 136        - **importance_summing_strategy_log_base** (`float` | `None`): base for the logarithm in the importance summing strategy (used when `importance_summing_strategy` is 'log_decrease'). Must be > 1.
 137        """
 138        super().__init__(
 139            backbone=backbone,
 140            heads=heads,
 141            adjustment_mode=None,  # use the own adjustment mechanism of FG-AdaHAT
 142            adjustment_intensity=adjustment_intensity,
 143            s_max=s_max,
 144            clamp_threshold=clamp_threshold,
 145            mask_sparsity_reg_factor=mask_sparsity_reg_factor,
 146            mask_sparsity_reg_mode=mask_sparsity_reg_mode,
 147            task_embedding_init_mode=task_embedding_init_mode,
 148            epsilon=base_mask_sparsity_reg,  # the epsilon is now the base mask sparsity regularization factor
 149        )
 150
 151        self.importance_type: str | None = importance_type
 152        r"""The type of the neuron-wise importance added to AdaHAT importance."""
 153
 154        self.importance_scheduler_type: str = importance_scheduler_type
 155        r"""Store the type of the importance scheduler."""
 156        self.neuron_to_weight_importance_aggregation_mode: str = (
 157            neuron_to_weight_importance_aggregation_mode
 158        )
 159        r"""The mode of aggregation from neuron-wise to weight-wise importance. """
 160        self.filter_by_cumulative_mask: bool = filter_by_cumulative_mask
 161        r"""The flag to filter importance by the cumulative mask when calculating the adjustment rate."""
 162        self.filter_unmasked_importance: bool = filter_unmasked_importance
 163        r"""The flag to filter unmasked importance values (set them to 0) at the end of task training."""
 164        self.step_multiply_training_mask: bool = step_multiply_training_mask
 165        r"""The flag to multiply the training mask to the importance at each training step."""
 166
 167        # importance summing strategy
 168        self.importance_summing_strategy: str = importance_summing_strategy
 169        r"""The strategy to sum the neuron-wise importance for previous tasks."""
 170        if importance_summing_strategy_linear_step is not None:
 171            self.importance_summing_strategy_linear_step: float = (
 172                importance_summing_strategy_linear_step
 173            )
 174            r"""The linear step for the importance summing strategy (only when `importance_summing_strategy` is 'linear_decrease')."""
 175        if importance_summing_strategy_exponential_rate is not None:
 176            self.importance_summing_strategy_exponential_rate: float = (
 177                importance_summing_strategy_exponential_rate
 178            )
 179            r"""The exponential rate for the importance summing strategy (only when `importance_summing_strategy` is 'exponential_decrease'). """
 180        if importance_summing_strategy_log_base is not None:
 181            self.importance_summing_strategy_log_base: float = (
 182                importance_summing_strategy_log_base
 183            )
 184            r"""The base for the logarithm in the importance summing strategy (only when `importance_summing_strategy` is 'log_decrease'). """
 185
 186        # base values
 187        self.base_importance: float = base_importance
 188        r"""The base value added to the importance to avoid zero. """
 189        self.base_mask_sparsity_reg: float = base_mask_sparsity_reg
 190        r"""The base value added to the mask sparsity regularization to avoid zero. """
 191        self.base_linear: float = base_linear
 192        r"""The base value added to the linear layer to avoid zero. """
 193
 194        self.importances: dict[int, dict[str, Tensor]] = {}
 195        r"""The min-max scaled ($[0, 1]$) neuron-wise importance of units. It is $I^{\tau}_{l}$ in the paper. Keys are task IDs and values are the corresponding importance tensors. Each importance tensor is a dict where keys are layer names and values are the importance tensor for the layer. The utility tensor is the same size as the feature tensor with size (number of units, ). """
 196        self.summative_importance_for_previous_tasks: dict[str, Tensor] = {}
 197        r"""The summative neuron-wise importance values of units for previous tasks before the current task `self.task_id`. See $I^{<t}_{l}$ in the paper. Keys are layer names and values are the summative importance tensor for the layer. The summative importance tensor has the same size as the feature tensor with size (number of units, ). """
 198
 199        self.num_steps_t: int
 200        r"""Store the number of training steps for the current task `self.task_id`."""
 201        # set manual optimization
 202        self.automatic_optimization = False
 203
 204        FGAdaHAT.sanity_check(self)
 205
 206    def sanity_check(self) -> None:
 207        r"""Check the sanity of the arguments."""
 208
 209        # check importance type
 210        if self.importance_type not in [
 211            "input_weight_abs_sum",
 212            "output_weight_abs_sum",
 213            "input_weight_gradient_abs_sum",
 214            "output_weight_gradient_abs_sum",
 215            "activation_abs",
 216            "input_weight_abs_sum_x_activation_abs",
 217            "output_weight_abs_sum_x_activation_abs",
 218            "gradient_x_activation_abs",
 219            "input_weight_gradient_square_sum",
 220            "output_weight_gradient_square_sum",
 221            "input_weight_gradient_square_sum_x_activation_abs",
 222            "output_weight_gradient_square_sum_x_activation_abs",
 223            "conductance_abs",
 224            "internal_influence_abs",
 225            "gradcam_abs",
 226            "deeplift_abs",
 227            "deepliftshap_abs",
 228            "gradientshap_abs",
 229            "integrated_gradients_abs",
 230            "feature_ablation_abs",
 231            "lrp_abs",
 232            "cbp_adaptation",
 233            "cbp_adaptive_contribution",
 234        ]:
 235            raise ValueError(
 236                f"importance_type must be one of the predefined types, but got {self.importance_type}"
 237            )
 238
 239        # check importance summing strategy
 240        if self.importance_summing_strategy not in [
 241            "add_latest",
 242            "add_all",
 243            "add_average",
 244            "linear_decrease",
 245            "quadratic_decrease",
 246            "cubic_decrease",
 247            "exponential_decrease",
 248            "log_decrease",
 249            "factorial_decrease",
 250        ]:
 251            raise ValueError(
 252                f"importance_summing_strategy must be one of the predefined strategies, but got {self.importance_summing_strategy}"
 253            )
 254
 255        # check importance scheduler type
 256        if self.importance_scheduler_type not in [
 257            "linear_sparsity_reg",
 258            "sparsity_reg",
 259            "summative_mask_sparsity_reg",
 260        ]:
 261            raise ValueError(
 262                f"importance_scheduler_type must be one of the predefined types, but got {self.importance_scheduler_type}"
 263            )
 264
 265        # check neuron to weight importance aggregation mode
 266        if self.neuron_to_weight_importance_aggregation_mode not in [
 267            "min",
 268            "max",
 269            "mean",
 270        ]:
 271            raise ValueError(
 272                f"neuron_to_weight_importance_aggregation_mode must be one of the predefined modes, but got {self.neuron_to_weight_importance_aggregation_mode}"
 273            )
 274
 275        # check base values
 276        if self.base_importance < 0:
 277            raise ValueError(
 278                f"base_importance must be >= 0, but got {self.base_importance}"
 279            )
 280        if self.base_mask_sparsity_reg <= 0:
 281            raise ValueError(
 282                f"base_mask_sparsity_reg must be > 0, but got {self.base_mask_sparsity_reg}"
 283            )
 284        if self.base_linear <= 0:
 285            raise ValueError(f"base_linear must be > 0, but got {self.base_linear}")
 286
 287    def on_train_start(self) -> None:
 288        r"""Initialize neuron importance accumulation variable for each layer as zeros, in addition to AdaHAT's summative mask initialization."""
 289        super().on_train_start()
 290
 291        self.importances[self.task_id] = (
 292            {}
 293        )  # initialize the importance for the current task
 294
 295        # initialize the neuron importance at the beginning of each task. This should not be called in `__init__()` method because `self.device` is not available at that time.
 296        for layer_name in self.backbone.weighted_layer_names:
 297            layer = self.backbone.get_layer_by_name(
 298                layer_name
 299            )  # get the layer by its name
 300            num_units = layer.weight.shape[0]
 301
 302            # initialize the accumulated importance at the beginning of each task
 303            self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name] = torch.zeros(num_units).to(
 304                self.device
 305            )
 306
 307            # reset the number of steps counter for the current task
 308            self.num_steps_t = 0
 309
 310            # initialize the summative neuron-wise importance at the beginning of the first task
 311            if self.task_id == 1:
 312                self.summative_importance_for_previous_tasks[layer_name] = torch.zeros(
 313                    num_units
 314                ).to(
 315                    self.device
 316                )  # the summative neuron-wise importance for previous tasks $I^{<t}_{l}$ is initialized as zeros mask when $t=1$
 317
 318    def clip_grad_by_adjustment(
 319        self,
 320        network_sparsity: dict[str, Tensor],
 321    ) -> tuple[dict[str, Tensor], dict[str, Tensor], Tensor]:
 322        r"""Clip the gradients by the adjustment rate. See Eq. (1) in the paper.
 323
 324        Note that because the task embedding fully covers every layer in the backbone network, no parameters are left out of this system. This applies not only to parameters between layers with task embeddings, but also to those before the first layer. We design it separately in the code.
 325
 326        Network capacity is measured alongside this method. Network capacity is defined as the average adjustment rate over all parameters. See Sec. 4.1 in the [AdaHAT paper](https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-70352-2_9).
 327
 328        **Args:**
 329        - **network_sparsity** (`dict[str, Tensor]`): the network sparsity (i.e., mask sparsity loss of each layer) for the current task. Keys are layer names and values are the network sparsity values. It is used to calculate the adjustment rate for gradients. In FG-AdaHAT, it is used to construct the importance scheduler.
 330
 331        **Returns:**
 332        - **adjustment_rate_weight** (`dict[str, Tensor]`): the adjustment rate for weights. Keys (`str`) are layer names and values (`Tensor`) are the adjustment rate tensors.
 333        - **adjustment_rate_bias** (`dict[str, Tensor]`): the adjustment rate for biases. Keys (`str`) are layer names and values (`Tensor`) are the adjustment rate tensors.
 334        - **capacity** (`Tensor`): the calculated network capacity.
 335        """
 336
 337        # initialize network capacity metric
 338        capacity = HATNetworkCapacityMetric().to(self.device)
 339        adjustment_rate_weight = {}
 340        adjustment_rate_bias = {}
 341
 342        # calculate the adjustment rate for gradients of the parameters, both weights and biases (if they exist). See Eq. (2) in the paper
 343        for layer_name in self.backbone.weighted_layer_names:
 344
 345            layer = self.backbone.get_layer_by_name(
 346                layer_name
 347            )  # get the layer by its name
 348
 349            # placeholder for the adjustment rate to avoid the error of using it before assignment
 350            adjustment_rate_weight_layer = 1
 351            adjustment_rate_bias_layer = 1
 352
 353            # aggregate the neuron-wise importance to weight-wise importance. Note that the neuron-wise importance has already been min-max scaled to $[0, 1]$ in the `on_train_batch_end()` method, added the base value, and filtered by the mask
 354            weight_importance, bias_importance = (
 355                self.backbone.get_layer_measure_parameter_wise(
 356                    unit_wise_measure=self.summative_importance_for_previous_tasks,
 357                    layer_name=layer_name,
 358                    aggregation_mode=self.neuron_to_weight_importance_aggregation_mode,
 359                )
 360            )
 361
 362            weight_mask, bias_mask = self.backbone.get_layer_measure_parameter_wise(
 363                unit_wise_measure=self.cumulative_mask_for_previous_tasks,
 364                layer_name=layer_name,
 365                aggregation_mode="min",
 366            )
 367
 368            # filter the weight importance by the cumulative mask
 369            if self.filter_by_cumulative_mask:
 370                weight_importance = weight_importance * weight_mask
 371                bias_importance = bias_importance * bias_mask
 372
 373            network_sparsity_layer = network_sparsity[layer_name]
 374
 375            # calculate importance scheduler (the factor of importance). See Eq. (3) in the paper
 376            factor = network_sparsity_layer + self.base_mask_sparsity_reg
 377            if self.importance_scheduler_type == "linear_sparsity_reg":
 378                factor = factor * (self.task_id + self.base_linear)
 379            elif self.importance_scheduler_type == "sparsity_reg":
 380                pass
 381            elif self.importance_scheduler_type == "summative_mask_sparsity_reg":
 382                factor = factor * (
 383                    self.summative_mask_for_previous_tasks + self.base_linear
 384                )
 385
 386            # calculate the adjustment rate
 387            adjustment_rate_weight_layer = torch.div(
 388                self.adjustment_intensity,
 389                (factor * weight_importance + self.adjustment_intensity),
 390            )
 391
 392            adjustment_rate_bias_layer = torch.div(
 393                self.adjustment_intensity,
 394                (factor * bias_importance + self.adjustment_intensity),
 395            )
 396
 397            # apply the adjustment rate to the gradients
 398            layer.weight.grad.data *= adjustment_rate_weight_layer
 399            if layer.bias is not None:
 400                layer.bias.grad.data *= adjustment_rate_bias_layer
 401
 402            # store the adjustment rate for logging
 403            adjustment_rate_weight[layer_name] = adjustment_rate_weight_layer
 404            if layer.bias is not None:
 405                adjustment_rate_bias[layer_name] = adjustment_rate_bias_layer
 406
 407            # update network capacity metric
 408            capacity.update(adjustment_rate_weight_layer, adjustment_rate_bias_layer)
 409
 410        return adjustment_rate_weight, adjustment_rate_bias, capacity.compute()
 411
 412    def on_train_batch_end(
 413        self, outputs: dict[str, Any], batch: Any, batch_idx: int
 414    ) -> None:
 415        r"""Calculate the step-wise importance, update the accumulated importance and number of steps counter after each training step.
 416
 417        **Args:**
 418        - **outputs** (`dict[str, Any]`): outputs of the training step (returns of `training_step()` in `CLAlgorithm`).
 419        - **batch** (`Any`): training data batch.
 420        - **batch_idx** (`int`): index of the current batch (for mask figure file name).
 421        """
 422
 423        # get potential useful information from training batch
 424        activations = outputs["activations"]
 425        input = outputs["input"]
 426        target = outputs["target"]
 427        mask = outputs["mask"]
 428        num_batches = self.trainer.num_training_batches
 429
 430        for layer_name in self.backbone.weighted_layer_names:
 431            # layer-wise operation
 432
 433            activation = activations[layer_name]
 434
 435            # calculate neuron-wise importance of the training step. See $I^{\tau}_l(\mathbf{x},y)$ (before Eqs. (5) and (6)) in the paper.
 436            if self.importance_type == "input_weight_abs_sum":
 437                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_abs_sum(
 438                    layer_name=layer_name,
 439                    if_output_weight=False,
 440                    reciprocal=False,
 441                )
 442            elif self.importance_type == "output_weight_abs_sum":
 443                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_abs_sum(
 444                    layer_name=layer_name,
 445                    if_output_weight=True,
 446                    reciprocal=False,
 447                )
 448            elif self.importance_type == "input_weight_gradient_abs_sum":
 449                importance_step = (
 450                    self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_gradient_abs_sum(
 451                        layer_name=layer_name, if_output_weight=False
 452                    )
 453                )
 454            elif self.importance_type == "output_weight_gradient_abs_sum":
 455                importance_step = (
 456                    self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_gradient_abs_sum(
 457                        layer_name=layer_name, if_output_weight=True
 458                    )
 459                )
 460            elif self.importance_type == "activation_abs":
 461                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_activation_abs(
 462                    activation=activation
 463                )
 464            elif self.importance_type == "input_weight_abs_sum_x_activation_abs":
 465                importance_step = (
 466                    self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_abs_sum_x_activation_abs(
 467                        layer_name=layer_name,
 468                        activation=activation,
 469                        if_output_weight=False,
 470                    )
 471                )
 472            elif self.importance_type == "output_weight_abs_sum_x_activation_abs":
 473                importance_step = (
 474                    self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_abs_sum_x_activation_abs(
 475                        layer_name=layer_name,
 476                        activation=activation,
 477                        if_output_weight=True,
 478                    )
 479                )
 480            elif self.importance_type == "gradient_x_activation_abs":
 481                importance_step = (
 482                    self.get_importance_step_layer_gradient_x_activation_abs(
 483                        layer_name=layer_name,
 484                        input=input,
 485                        target=target,
 486                        batch_idx=batch_idx,
 487                        num_batches=num_batches,
 488                    )
 489                )
 490            elif self.importance_type == "input_weight_gradient_square_sum":
 491                importance_step = (
 492                    self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_gradient_square_sum(
 493                        layer_name=layer_name,
 494                        activation=activation,
 495                        if_output_weight=False,
 496                    )
 497                )
 498            elif self.importance_type == "output_weight_gradient_square_sum":
 499                importance_step = (
 500                    self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_gradient_square_sum(
 501                        layer_name=layer_name,
 502                        activation=activation,
 503                        if_output_weight=True,
 504                    )
 505                )
 506            elif (
 507                self.importance_type
 508                == "input_weight_gradient_square_sum_x_activation_abs"
 509            ):
 510                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_gradient_square_sum_x_activation_abs(
 511                    layer_name=layer_name,
 512                    activation=activation,
 513                    if_output_weight=False,
 514                )
 515            elif (
 516                self.importance_type
 517                == "output_weight_gradient_square_sum_x_activation_abs"
 518            ):
 519                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_gradient_square_sum_x_activation_abs(
 520                    layer_name=layer_name,
 521                    activation=activation,
 522                    if_output_weight=True,
 523                )
 524            elif self.importance_type == "conductance_abs":
 525                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_conductance_abs(
 526                    layer_name=layer_name,
 527                    input=input,
 528                    baselines=None,
 529                    target=target,
 530                    batch_idx=batch_idx,
 531                    num_batches=num_batches,
 532                )
 533            elif self.importance_type == "internal_influence_abs":
 534                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_internal_influence_abs(
 535                    layer_name=layer_name,
 536                    input=input,
 537                    baselines=None,
 538                    target=target,
 539                    batch_idx=batch_idx,
 540                    num_batches=num_batches,
 541                )
 542            elif self.importance_type == "gradcam_abs":
 543                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_gradcam_abs(
 544                    layer_name=layer_name,
 545                    input=input,
 546                    target=target,
 547                    batch_idx=batch_idx,
 548                    num_batches=num_batches,
 549                )
 550            elif self.importance_type == "deeplift_abs":
 551                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_deeplift_abs(
 552                    layer_name=layer_name,
 553                    input=input,
 554                    baselines=None,
 555                    target=target,
 556                    batch_idx=batch_idx,
 557                    num_batches=num_batches,
 558                )
 559            elif self.importance_type == "deepliftshap_abs":
 560                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_deepliftshap_abs(
 561                    layer_name=layer_name,
 562                    input=input,
 563                    baselines=None,
 564                    target=target,
 565                    batch_idx=batch_idx,
 566                    num_batches=num_batches,
 567                )
 568            elif self.importance_type == "gradientshap_abs":
 569                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_gradientshap_abs(
 570                    layer_name=layer_name,
 571                    input=input,
 572                    baselines=None,
 573                    target=target,
 574                    batch_idx=batch_idx,
 575                    num_batches=num_batches,
 576                )
 577            elif self.importance_type == "integrated_gradients_abs":
 578                importance_step = (
 579                    self.get_importance_step_layer_integrated_gradients_abs(
 580                        layer_name=layer_name,
 581                        input=input,
 582                        baselines=None,
 583                        target=target,
 584                        batch_idx=batch_idx,
 585                        num_batches=num_batches,
 586                    )
 587                )
 588            elif self.importance_type == "feature_ablation_abs":
 589                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_feature_ablation_abs(
 590                    layer_name=layer_name,
 591                    input=input,
 592                    layer_baselines=None,
 593                    target=target,
 594                    batch_idx=batch_idx,
 595                    num_batches=num_batches,
 596                )
 597            elif self.importance_type == "lrp_abs":
 598                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_lrp_abs(
 599                    layer_name=layer_name,
 600                    input=input,
 601                    target=target,
 602                    batch_idx=batch_idx,
 603                    num_batches=num_batches,
 604                )
 605            elif self.importance_type == "cbp_adaptation":
 606                importance_step = self.get_importance_step_layer_weight_abs_sum(
 607                    layer_name=layer_name,
 608                    if_output_weight=False,
 609                    reciprocal=True,
 610                )
 611            elif self.importance_type == "cbp_adaptive_contribution":
 612                importance_step = (
 613                    self.get_importance_step_layer_cbp_adaptive_contribution(
 614                        layer_name=layer_name,
 615                        activation=activation,
 616                    )
 617                )
 618
 619            importance_step = min_max_normalize(
 620                importance_step
 621            )  # min-max scaling the utility to $[0, 1]$. See Eq. (5) in the paper
 622
 623            # multiply the importance by the training mask. See Eq. (6) in the paper
 624            if self.step_multiply_training_mask:
 625                importance_step = importance_step * mask[layer_name]
 626
 627            # update accumulated importance
 628            self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name] = (
 629                self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name] + importance_step
 630            )
 631
 632        # update number of steps counter
 633        self.num_steps_t += 1
 634
 635    def on_train_end(self) -> None:
 636        r"""Additionally calculate neuron-wise importance for previous tasks at the end of training each task."""
 637        super().on_train_end()  # store the mask and update cumulative and summative masks
 638
 639        for layer_name in self.backbone.weighted_layer_names:
 640
 641            # average the neuron-wise step importance. See Eq. (4) in the paper
 642            self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name] = (
 643                self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name]
 644            ) / self.num_steps_t
 645
 646            # add the base importance. See Eq. (6) in the paper
 647            self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name] = (
 648                self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name] + self.base_importance
 649            )
 650
 651            # filter unmasked importance
 652            if self.filter_unmasked_importance:
 653                self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name] = (
 654                    self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name]
 655                    * self.backbone.masks[f"{self.task_id}"][layer_name]
 656                )
 657
 658            # calculate the summative neuron-wise importance for previous tasks. See Eq. (4) in the paper
 659            if self.importance_summing_strategy == "add_latest":
 660                self.summative_importance_for_previous_tasks[
 661                    layer_name
 662                ] += self.importances[self.task_id][layer_name]
 663
 664            elif self.importance_summing_strategy == "add_all":
 665                for t in range(1, self.task_id + 1):
 666                    self.summative_importance_for_previous_tasks[
 667                        layer_name
 668                    ] += self.importances[t][layer_name]
 669
 670            elif self.importance_summing_strategy == "add_average":
 671                for t in range(1, self.task_id + 1):
 672                    self.summative_importance_for_previous_tasks[layer_name] += (
 673                        self.importances[t][layer_name] / self.task_id
 674                    )
 675            else:
 676                self.summative_importance_for_previous_tasks[
 677                    layer_name
 678                ] = torch.zeros_like(
 679                    self.summative_importance_for_previous_tasks[layer_name]
 680                ).to(
 681                    self.device
 682                )  # starting adding from 0
 683
 684                if self.importance_summing_strategy == "linear_decrease":
 685                    s = self.importance_summing_strategy_linear_step
 686                    for t in range(1, self.task_id + 1):
 687                        w_t = s * (self.task_id - t) + 1
 688
 689                elif self.importance_summing_strategy == "quadratic_decrease":
 690                    for t in range(1, self.task_id + 1):
 691                        w_t = (self.task_id - t + 1) ** 2
 692                elif self.importance_summing_strategy == "cubic_decrease":
 693                    for t in range(1, self.task_id + 1):
 694                        w_t = (self.task_id - t + 1) ** 3
 695                elif self.importance_summing_strategy == "exponential_decrease":
 696                    for t in range(1, self.task_id + 1):
 697                        r = self.importance_summing_strategy_exponential_rate
 698
 699                        w_t = r ** (self.task_id - t + 1)
 700                elif self.importance_summing_strategy == "log_decrease":
 701                    a = self.importance_summing_strategy_log_base
 702                    for t in range(1, self.task_id + 1):
 703                        w_t = math.log(self.task_id - t, a) + 1
 704                elif self.importance_summing_strategy == "factorial_decrease":
 705                    for t in range(1, self.task_id + 1):
 706                        w_t = math.factorial(self.task_id - t + 1)
 707                else:
 708                    raise ValueError
 709                self.summative_importance_for_previous_tasks[layer_name] += (
 710                    self.importances[t][layer_name] * w_t
 711                )
 712
 713    def get_importance_step_layer_weight_abs_sum(
 714        self: str,
 715        layer_name: str,
 716        if_output_weight: bool,
 717        reciprocal: bool,
 718    ) -> Tensor:
 719        r"""Get the raw neuron-wise importance (before scaling) of a layer of a training step. See $I^{\tau}_l(\mathbf{x},y)$ (before Eqs. (5) and (6)) in the paper. This method uses the sum of absolute values of layer input or output weights.
 720
 721        **Args:**
 722        - **layer_name** (`str`): the name of layer to get neuron-wise importance.
 723        - **if_output_weight** (`bool`): whether to use the output weights or input weights.
 724        - **reciprocal** (`bool`): whether to take reciprocal.
 725
 726        **Returns:**
 727        - **importance_step_layer** (`Tensor`): the neuron-wise importance of the layer of the training step.
 728        """
 729        layer = self.backbone.get_layer_by_name(layer_name)
 730
 731        if not if_output_weight:
 732            weight_abs = torch.abs(layer.weight.data)
 733            weight_abs_sum = torch.sum(
 734                weight_abs,
 735                dim=[
 736                    i for i in range(weight_abs.dim()) if i != 0
 737                ],  # sum over the input dimension
 738            )
 739        else:
 740            weight_abs = torch.abs(self.next_layer(layer_name).weight.data)
 741            weight_abs_sum = torch.sum(
 742                weight_abs,
 743                dim=[
 744                    i for i in range(weight_abs.dim()) if i != 1
 745                ],  # sum over the output dimension
 746            )
 747
 748        if reciprocal:
 749            weight_abs_sum_reciprocal = torch.reciprocal(weight_abs_sum)
 750            importance_step_layer = weight_abs_sum_reciprocal
 751        else:
 752            importance_step_layer = weight_abs_sum
 753        importance_step_layer = importance_step_layer.detach()
 754
 755        return importance_step_layer
 756
 757    def get_importance_step_layer_weight_gradient_abs_sum(
 758        self: str,
 759        layer_name: str,
 760        if_output_weight: bool,
 761    ) -> Tensor:
 762        r"""Get the raw neuron-wise importance (before scaling) of a layer of a training step. See $I^{\tau}_l(\mathbf{x},y)$ (before Eqs. (5) and (6)) in the paper. This method uses the sum of absolute values of gradients of the layer input or output weights.
 763
 764        **Args:**
 765        - **layer_name** (`str`): the name of layer to get neuron-wise importance.
 766        - **if_output_weight** (`bool`): whether to use the output weights or input weights.
 767
 768        **Returns:**
 769        - **importance_step_layer** (`Tensor`): the neuron-wise importance of the layer of the training step.
 770        """
 771        layer = self.backbone.get_layer_by_name(layer_name)
 772
 773        if not if_output_weight:
 774            gradient_abs = torch.abs(layer.weight.grad.data)
 775            gradient_abs_sum = torch.sum(
 776                gradient_abs,
 777                dim=[
 778                    i for i in range(gradient_abs.dim()) if i != 0
 779                ],  # sum over the input dimension
 780            )
 781        else:
 782            gradient_abs = torch.abs(self.next_layer(layer_name).weight.grad.data)
 783            gradient_abs_sum = torch.sum(
 784                gradient_abs,
 785                dim=[
 786                    i for i in range(gradient_abs.dim()) if i != 1
 787                ],  # sum over the output dimension
 788            )
 789
 790        importance_step_layer = gradient_abs_sum
 791        importance_step_layer = importance_step_layer.detach()
 792
 793        return importance_step_layer
 794
 795    def get_importance_step_layer_activation_abs(
 796        self: str,
 797        activation: Tensor,
 798    ) -> Tensor:
 799        r"""Get the raw neuron-wise importance (before scaling) of a layer of a training step. See $I^{\tau}_l(\mathbf{x},y)$ (before Eqs. (5) and (6)) in the paper. This method uses the absolute value of activation of the layer. This is our own implementation of [Layer Activation](https://captum.ai/api/layer.html#layer-activation) in Captum.
 800
 801        **Args:**
 802        - **activation** (`Tensor`): the activation tensor of the layer. It has the same size of (number of units, ).
 803
 804        **Returns:**
 805        - **importance_step_layer** (`Tensor`): the neuron-wise importance of the layer of the training step.
 806        """
 807        activation_abs_batch_mean = torch.mean(
 808            torch.abs(activation),
 809            dim=[
 810                i for i in range(activation.dim()) if i != 1
 811            ],  # average the features over batch samples
 812        )
 813        importance_step_layer = activation_abs_batch_mean
 814        importance_step_layer = importance_step_layer.detach()
 815
 816        return importance_step_layer
 817
 818    def get_importance_step_layer_weight_abs_sum_x_activation_abs(
 819        self: str,
 820        layer_name: str,
 821        activation: Tensor,
 822        if_output_weight: bool,
 823    ) -> Tensor:
 824        r"""Get the raw neuron-wise importance (before scaling) of a layer of a training step. See $I^{\tau}_l(\mathbf{x},y)$ (before Eqs. (5) and (6)) in the paper. This method uses the sum of absolute values of layer input / output weights multiplied by absolute values of activation. The input weights version is equal to the contribution utility in [CBP](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-024-07711-7).
 825
 826        **Args:**
 827        - **layer_name** (`str`): the name of layer to get neuron-wise importance.
 828        - **activation** (`Tensor`): the activation tensor of the layer. It has the same size of (number of units, ).
 829        - **if_output_weight** (`bool`): whether to use the output weights or input weights.
 830
 831        **Returns:**
 832        - **importance_step_layer** (`Tensor`): the neuron-wise importance of the layer of the training step.
 833        """
 834        layer = self.backbone.get_layer_by_name(layer_name)
 835
 836        if not if_output_weight:
 837            weight_abs = torch.abs(layer.weight.data)
 838            weight_abs_sum = torch.sum(
 839                weight_abs,
 840                dim=[
 841                    i for i in range(weight_abs.dim()) if i != 0
 842                ],  # sum over the input dimension
 843            )
 844        else:
 845            weight_abs = torch.abs(self.next_layer(layer_name).weight.data)
 846            weight_abs_sum = torch.sum(
 847                weight_abs,
 848                dim=[
 849                    i for i in range(weight_abs.dim()) if i != 1
 850                ],  # sum over the output dimension
 851            )
 852
 853        activation_abs_batch_mean = torch.mean(
 854            torch.abs(activation),
 855            dim=[
 856                i for i in range(activation.dim()) if i != 1
 857            ],  # average the features over batch samples
 858        )
 859
 860        importance_step_layer = weight_abs_sum * activation_abs_batch_mean
 861        importance_step_layer = importance_step_layer.detach()
 862
 863        return importance_step_layer
 864
 865    def get_importance_step_layer_gradient_x_activation_abs(
 866        self: str,
 867        layer_name: str,
 868        input: Tensor | tuple[Tensor, ...],
 869        target: Tensor | None,
 870        batch_idx: int,
 871        num_batches: int,
 872    ) -> Tensor:
 873        r"""Get the raw neuron-wise importance (before scaling) of a layer of a training step. See $I^{\tau}_l(\mathbf{x},y)$ (before Eqs. (5) and (6)) in the paper. This method uses the absolute values of the gradient of layer activation multiplied by the activation. We implement this using [Layer Gradient X Activation](https://captum.ai/api/layer.html#layer-gradient-x-activation) in Captum.
 874
 875        **Args:**
 876        - **layer_name** (`str`): the name of layer to get neuron-wise importance.
 877        - **input** (`Tensor` | `tuple[Tensor, ...]`): the input batch of the training step.
 878        - **target** (`Tensor` | `None`): the target batch of the training step.
 879        - **batch_idx** (`int`): the index of the current batch. This is an argument of the forward function during training.
 880        - **num_batches** (`int`): the number of batches in the training step. This is an argument of the forward function during training.
 881
 882        **Returns:**
 883        - **importance_step_layer** (`Tensor`): the neuron-wise importance of the layer of the training step.
 884        """
 885        layer = self.backbone.get_layer_by_name(layer_name)
 886
 887        input = input.requires_grad_()
 888
 889        # initialize the Layer Gradient X Activation object
 890        layer_gradient_x_activation = LayerGradientXActivation(
 891            forward_func=self.forward, layer=layer
 892        )
 893
 894        self.set_forward_func_return_logits_only(True)
 895        # calculate layer attribution of the step
 896        attribution = layer_gradient_x_activation.attribute(
 897            inputs=input,
 898            target=target,
 899            additional_forward_args=("train", batch_idx, num_batches, self.task_id),
 900        )
 901        self.set_forward_func_return_logits_only(False)
 902
 903        attribution_abs_batch_mean = torch.mean(
 904            torch.abs(attribution),
 905            dim=[
 906                i for i in range(attribution.dim()) if i != 1
 907            ],  # average the features over batch samples
 908        )
 909
 910        importance_step_layer = attribution_abs_batch_mean
 911        importance_step_layer = importance_step_layer.detach()
 912
 913        return importance_step_layer
 914
 915    def get_importance_step_layer_weight_gradient_square_sum(
 916        self: str,
 917        layer_name: str,
 918        activation: Tensor,
 919        if_output_weight: bool,
 920    ) -> Tensor:
 921        r"""Get the raw neuron-wise importance (before scaling) of a layer of a training step. See $I^{\tau}_l(\mathbf{x},y)$ (before Eqs. (5) and (6)) in the paper. This method uses the sum of layer weight gradient squares. The weight gradient square is equal to fisher information in [EWC](https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.1611835114).
 922
 923        **Args:**
 924        - **layer_name** (`str`): the name of layer to get neuron-wise importance.
 925        - **activation** (`Tensor`): the activation tensor of the layer. It has the same size of (number of units, ).
 926        - **if_output_weight** (`bool`): whether to use the output weights or input weights.
 927
 928        **Returns:**
 929        - **importance_step_layer** (`Tensor`): the neuron-wise importance of the layer of the training step.
 930        """
 931        layer = self.backbone.get_layer_by_name(layer_name)
 932
 933        if not if_output_weight:
 934            gradient_square = layer.weight.grad.data**2
 935            gradient_square_sum = torch.sum(
 936                gradient_square,
 937                dim=[
 938                    i for i in range(gradient_square.dim()) if i != 0
 939                ],  # sum over the input dimension
 940            )
 941        else:
 942            gradient_square = self.next_layer(layer_name).weight.grad.data**2
 943            gradient_square_sum = torch.sum(
 944                gradient_square,
 945                dim=[
 946                    i for i in range(gradient_square.dim()) if i != 1
 947                ],  # sum over the output dimension
 948            )
 949
 950        importance_step_layer = gradient_square_sum
 951        importance_step_layer = importance_step_layer.detach()
 952
 953        return importance_step_layer
 954
 955    def get_importance_step_layer_weight_gradient_square_sum_x_activation_abs(
 956        self: str,
 957        layer_name: str,
 958        activation: Tensor,
 959        if_output_weight: bool,
 960    ) -> Tensor:
 961        r"""Get the raw neuron-wise importance (before scaling) of a layer of a training step. See $I^{\tau}_l(\mathbf{x},y)$ (before Eqs. (5) and (6)) in the paper. This method uses the sum of layer weight gradient squares multiplied by absolute values of activation. The weight gradient square is equal to fisher information in [EWC](https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.1611835114).
 962
 963        **Args:**
 964        - **layer_name** (`str`): the name of layer to get neuron-wise importance.
 965        - **activation** (`Tensor`): the activation tensor of the layer. It has the same size of (number of units, ).
 966        - **if_output_weight** (`bool`): whether to use the output weights or input weights.
 967
 968        **Returns:**
 969        - **importance_step_layer** (`Tensor`): the neuron-wise importance of the layer of the training step.
 970        """
 971        layer = self.backbone.get_layer_by_name(layer_name)
 972
 973        if not if_output_weight:
 974            gradient_square = layer.weight.grad.data**2
 975            gradient_square_sum = torch.sum(
 976                gradient_square,
 977                dim=[
 978                    i for i in range(gradient_square.dim()) if i != 0
 979                ],  # sum over the input dimension
 980            )
 981        else:
 982            gradient_square = self.next_layer(layer_name).weight.grad.data**2
 983            gradient_square_sum = torch.sum(
 984                gradient_square,
 985                dim=[
 986                    i for i in range(gradient_square.dim()) if i != 1
 987                ],  # sum over the output dimension
 988            )
 989
 990        activation_abs_batch_mean = torch.mean(
 991            torch.abs(activation),
 992            dim=[
 993                i for i in range(activation.dim()) if i != 1
 994            ],  # average the features over batch samples
 995        )
 996
 997        importance_step_layer = gradient_square_sum * activation_abs_batch_mean
 998        importance_step_layer = importance_step_layer.detach()
 999
1000        return importance_step_layer
1001
1002    def get_importance_step_layer_conductance_abs(
1003        self: str,
1004        layer_name: str,
1005        input: Tensor | tuple[Tensor, ...],
1006        baselines: None | int | float | Tensor | tuple[int | float | Tensor, ...],
1007        target: Tensor | None,
1008        batch_idx: int,
1009        num_batches: int,
1010    ) -> Tensor:
1011        r"""Get the raw neuron-wise importance (before scaling) of a layer of a training step. See $I^{\tau}_l(\mathbf{x},y)$ (before Eqs. (5) and (6)) in the paper. This method uses the absolute values of [conductance](https://openreview.net/forum?id=SylKoo0cKm). We implement this using [Layer Conductance](https://captum.ai/api/layer.html#layer-conductance) in Captum.
1012
1013        **Args:**
1014        - **layer_name** (`str`): the name of layer to get neuron-wise importance.
1015        - **input** (`Tensor` | `tuple[Tensor, ...]`): the input batch of the training step.
1016        - **baselines** (`None` | `int` | `float` | `Tensor` | `tuple[int | float | Tensor, ...]`): starting point from which integral is computed in this method. Please refer to the [Captum documentation](https://captum.ai/api/layer.html#captum.attr.LayerConductance.attribute) for more details.
1017        - **target** (`Tensor` | `None`): the target batch of the training step.
1018        - **batch_idx** (`int`): the index of the current batch. This is an argument of the forward function during training.
1019        - **num_batches** (`int`): the number of batches in the training step. This is an argument of the forward function during training.- **mask** (`Tensor`): the mask tensor of the layer. It has the same size as the feature tensor with size (number of units, ).
1020
1021        **Returns:**
1022        - **importance_step_layer** (`Tensor`): the neuron-wise importance of the layer of the training step.
1023        """
1024        layer = self.backbone.get_layer_by_name(layer_name)
1025
1026        # initialize the Layer Conductance object
1027        layer_conductance = LayerConductance(forward_func=self.forward, layer=layer)
1028
1029        self.set_forward_func_return_logits_only(True)
1030        # calculate layer attribution of the step
1031        attribution = layer_conductance.attribute(
1032            inputs=input,
1033            baselines=baselines,
1034            target=target,
1035            additional_forward_args=("train", batch_idx, num_batches, self.task_id),
1036        )
1037        self.set_forward_func_return_logits_only(False)
1038
1039        attribution_abs_batch_mean = torch.mean(
1040            torch.abs(attribution),
1041            dim=[
1042                i for i in range(attribution.dim()) if i != 1
1043            ],  # average the features over batch samples
1044        )
1045
1046        importance_step_layer = attribution_abs_batch_mean
1047        importance_step_layer = importance_step_layer.detach()
1048
1049        return importance_step_layer

1297        self.set_forward_func_return_logits_only(False)
